title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 23 june [1869]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 23 June [1869]
text: â€”1869June 23Dear Walti have receevedreceived your letter to day all safe with the envelopes and all right i had Mr Burroughs and his friend to see me yesterday tuesdayTuesday they got in yesterday morning and was going to leave at 4 oclo'clock in the afternoon they were here about an hour i think i should like burrouhsBurroughs very much and the man with him too was very friendly it didentdidn't put me aback in the least things were in order and i happened to have on a clean cap they thought the house very good and your portrait attracted theertheir special attention i asked them to stay and have dinner but they declined said they could not as they had to go somewhersomewhere i beleivebelieve & i was glad to hear you had been there last sundaySunday and took breakfast) it has been very hot here and so much cloudy unwholsomeunwholesome weather i have felt quite bad some part of the time worst i would feel would be in the morning when i first got up i would feel so exaustedexhausted as if i never could doodo any thing but when i got some coffee i would feel better but these two or three mornings back i have felt better) georgeGeorge has not been home since i wrote last to you he didentdidn't know but they would send for him to inspect here but i suppose they haveenthaven't he says he has to work real hard out there so many pipe to handle but he feels pretty well has a good appetite he says he has the rheumatis in his legs and hip i dontdon't think its the rheumatis at all i think its the affects of his fever when he was a prisoner in the war well waltWalt i have had a letter from mattyMatty the other day they seem to be all getting along finely mattyMatty sent me two 25 cent bills quite a lift wasentwasn't it waltWalt well waltWalt i dontdon't want to complain of any body but i doodo think sometimes they might send me a few dollars but to send 50 cents i thought it rather small when i think of what i have done for them i dontdon't think i would be indebted if they was to send me considerable) Jeff sent a letter to George after he left for camdenCamden wanted an immediate answer) now waltWalt i will tell you all about the affairs between georgeGeorge and jeffJeff i think you will understand it in the first place jeffJeff let georgeGeorge have 500 dollars georgeGeorge gave him a note forit and then he let him have 500 hund more he gave him a note for that that made 1000 dollars one was given last augustAugust and the other last septemberSeptember and when matt was on here georgeGeorge lent her 50 dollars she told jeffJeff to pay georgeGeorge but he didentdidn't so georgeGeorge thought it could go to pay the interest of the notes or toward it) when jeffJeff was on i said to him couldentcouldn't he let georgeGeorge have what money he would want to build with and take a mortgage on this house i thought it would be an advantage to jeffJeff as well as georgeGeorge so he asked georgeGeorge how much he would want and georgeGeorge told him three thousand dollars jeffJeff said he would let him know when he went back and georgeGeorge said when the other house was sold he would pay off the two notes and only have the three thousand stand well jeffJeff sent drafts at different times till he had sent it all but 600 dollars that was to make out the mortgage you see waltWalt and then he stopped didentdidn't send any more finally the mortgage was made out and executed and left at the recorders office and six hundred wasentwasn't received so when georgeGeorge was home he said that six hundred he should keep to pay you and when the house was sold he should have some coming and would make up enoughfenough to pay off the notes to jeffJeff) well this letter to georgeGeorge was to see if georgeGeorge couldentcouldn't pay the notes off as jeffyJeffy wanted to go into some speclulationspeculation in an iron furnace manufactory but he said for georgeGeorge to not sell the house by any means so i wrote a letter to him that georgeGeorge was away and would be home in 2 weeks and that he had transferedtransferred the 1000 dollar mortgage on the steers property to the mason that done the work) jeffJeff wrote to know if georgeGeorge held that mortgage yet so i dontdon't know how it go) if you cantcan't understand walterWalter dear you must read it over two or three times) when matt wrote to me she generally asks how waltWalt is and they would like to have you come on there well i dare say they would well i said in my letter to matt waltWalt seems quite well now and the same good old standby sends eddEdd and me our daily substance i thought afterwards maybe they would think it was a hint to them but i thought i didentdidn't care good bie Walter it will bring it near septemberSeptember if you dontdon't come till two months well come when you will we will be glad to see you and you will be welcome walterWalter dear Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 23 June [1869]
